channel.title: Inigo Val Slijepcevic
channel.description: Recent content on Inigo Val Slijepcevic

item.title: quick resume
item.description: Education MPhys - Oxford University (Jesus College) - Scholar 4 year integrated masters degree, focus on Theoretical Physics and Astrophysics. Awarded a scholarship by Jesus College for high academic achievement. Masters thesis applied machine learning to pulsar classification. Research & Professional Experience PhD Student | 09.20 - Present | Manchester, UK Applying machine learning to astronomical image classification, particularly with very large data-sets with few labels and a hierarchical, fine-grained class structure.

item.title: Resume
item.description: Education MPhys - Oxford University (Jesus College) - Scholar 4 year integrated masters degree, with focus on Theoretical Physics and Astrophysics. Awarded a scholarship by Jesus College for high academic achievement. Research & Professional Experience PhD Student | 09.20 - Present | Manchester, UK Applying & developing cutting edge machine learning techniques to improve radio galaxy classification. Currently developing bespoke contrastive learning techniques for astronomical data. Used semi-supervised learning to leverage unlabelled data for classification.

item.title: Publications
item.description: NeurIPS 2021 | Machine Learning and the Physical Sciences Workshop | Can semi-supervised learning reduce the amount of manual labelling required for effective radio galaxy morphology classification? | https://github.com/inigoval/fixmatch

item.title: About
item.description: Machine learning/Astronomy PhD student with Dr Anna Scaife @ University of Manchester. University of Oxford MPhys graduate. Research and PhD Work I am working on building robust machine learning systems to process the vast deluge of data (exabyte scale) we are about to receive from next-generation telescopes. Since this much data cannot be curated by humans, we need AI that can deal with messy, real-world data with few labels and many possible anomalies.
